name: alsi1d
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

stmt.origin: simpld(w0, wal(s0, wi(w1, w2)), wex(s0, w1))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wal(s0, wi(w1, w2)))
-| wi(w0, wa(wal(s0, wi(w1, w2)), wex(s0, w1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wal(s0, wi(w1, w2)))
-| wi(w0, wa(wal(s0, wi(w1, w2)), wex(s0, w1)))

stmt.origin: sylib(w0, wa(wal(s0, wi(w1, w2)), wex(s0, w1)), walsi(s0, w1, w2))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wa(wal(s0, wi(w1, w2)), wex(s0, w1)))
-| wi(w0, walsi(s0, w1, w2))
-| wb(walsi(s0, w1, w2), wa(wal(s0, wi(w1, w2)), wex(s0, w1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wal(s0, wi(w1, w2)))
-| wi(w0, walsi(s0, w1, w2))
-| wb(walsi(s0, w1, w2), wa(wal(s0, wi(w1, w2)), wex(s0, w1)))

body.origin: |- wb(walsi(s0, w1, w2), wa(wal(s0, wi(w1, w2)), wex(s0, w1)))

cumulated.origin:

-| wi(w0, walsi(s0, w1, w2))

comment: Deduction rule: Given "all some" applied to a top-level inference, you can extract the "for all" part. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 20-Oct-2018.)
